scenario_description: Luke was in his third year of college. He was ecstatic and curious when he heard about a film studies course. He thought it had to be too good to be true. He was aw realizing all they did was sit around studying movies. He got an A in the course and changed his major to film studies.

action_plan: Explain(Professor_Smith, Fellow_Students, "the importance of film studies as a field of study")
Ask(Question(Professor_Smith, "What movie did you watch last weekend?"), Fellow_Students)
Assign(Professor_Smith, Fellow_Students, "analyzing a specific movie scene in pairs and present their analysis to the class")
Provide(Professor_Smith, Fellow_Students, "feedback on their movie scene analysis")
Organize(Professor_Smith, Fellow_Students, "a debate about the meaning of a particular movie scene")
Encourage(Professor_Smith, Luke, "to continue studying film studies")
Plan_Class_Presentation(Professor_Smith, None, Prompt= "What makes a movie great?")
Provide_Feedback_on_Student_Research(Professor_Smith, Luke, Feedback_Text="Great analysis on that last paper, Luke. The way you examined the symbolism was impressive!")
Encourage_Student_Discussion(Professor_Smith, Fellow_Students, Topic="The Use of Flashbacks in Cinematography")
Provide_Individual_Feedback_to_Groups(Professor_Smith, None, Feedback_Text="You guys did a great job working together and your analysis was on-point!")
Assign_Reflective_Writing_Assignment(Professor_Smith, None, Prompt="Reflect on what you learned this semester and how it will influence your perspective on film going forward")

effects: BEL(Professor_Smith, Presentation_Prompt) = "What makes a movie great?"
BEL(Luke, Feedback_on_Analysis) = "Great analysis on that last paper, Luke. The way you examined the symbolism was impressive!"

action_plan: Ask_Question(Discussion_Participant, Professor_Smith, "May I Ask A Question?")
Start_Conversation(Discussion_Participant, Luke, "What Did You Think About The Lecture?")
Connect_With_Luke(Discussion_Participant, Luke, "We Should Talk More About This Later!")

dialogue_tree: <Start, A1, Greeting, Neutral, "Hello! How are you doing today?">
<A1, A2, Question, Curious, "Have you heard about the new film studies course this semester?">
<A2, A3, Information, Enthusiastic, "I'm thinking of taking it, studying movies all semester sounds like a dream come true!">
<A3, A4, Confirmation, Hopeful, "Do you think it's worth taking? Will it be easy, or hard?">
<A4, A5, Confirmation, Encouraging, "You should definitely take it! It can be challenging, but it will be so rewarding. Plus, you have a natural interest in movies, which will help.">
<A5, A6, Question, Inquisitive, "What did you think of the course? About the workload and the requirements?">
<A6, A7, Information, Excited, "I loved it! The course is stimulating, and the workload is manageable. You get to watch a lot of movies, and you will learn a lot about the art of filmmaking.">
<A7, End, Farewell, Neutral, "You should definitely take the course! Good luck!">
